details.title: COVID-19 recap from October 2
details.content:
The national capital recorded 37 COVID-19 fatalities on Friday as the toll climbed to 5,438, while 2,920 fresh cases took the tally to over 2.85 lakh, authorities said. 
(READ ALL UPDATES HERE)

details.title: EDITORIAL | Ensuring vaccine for COVID-19 reaches all
details.content:
An immunisation strategy needs to be put in place before the rush begins. Who will get priority? Is it safe for the elderly and vulnerable to get it first as this is after all a novel virus and a novel vaccine? Will it be subsidised or even distributed at no cost by the government?
(READ FULL EDITORIAL HERE)

(Photo | AP)

details.title: COVID-19 toll crosses one lakh-mark in India, Maharashtra tops chart with 37,490 deaths
details.content:
• Globally, India, so far, has the third highest COVID-19 deaths after the US which has reported over 2 lakh deaths and Brazil where 1.4 lakh deaths have been registered.
  • The deaths in India are still growing at a rate of 1.1 per cent even though the overall case fatality rate has been declining and has now reached 1.6 per cent.

(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: WATCH | US President Donald Trump, first lady Melania test COVID-19 positive
Unlock 5: States with high COVID-19 caseloads not keen to reopen schools
details.content:
Despite the Centre’s fresh guidelines for Unlock 5.0, giving states and UTs the powers to decide on re-opening of schools and coaching institutions after October 15, most states struggling with high Covid-19 cases are in no hurry to do so very soon, said sources in the Union Education Ministry.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

25 States/Union Territories have reported fall in the number of active cases during the last week: Union Ministry of Health & Family Welfare #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/iF8mBFeId7

— ANI (@ANI) October 3, 2020

details.title: Home isolation for COVID-19 cases in Delhi more on October 1 after gradual fall
details.content:
After showing a gradual decline in the last week of September, the number of Covid-19 patients under home quarantine in Delhi has risen in October, according to official data. 
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Reminder | Wear mask, limit the spread of COVID-19 but also practice social distancing
details.content: (Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)

details.title: COVID-19 death rate in Delhi goes up in last 10 days
details.content:
he national capital in the last ten days had witnessed a rise in the deaths due to coronavirus. The mortalities are ranging from 35 to 45 on an average daily. Currently, the death toll of Delhi stands at 5,438. 
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: India's COVID-19 tally reaches 64,73,545 with 79,476 new cases in last 24-hours
Global update | US Presidential nominee Joe Biden tests negative for COVID-19
details.content:
• Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden and his wife have tested negative for the novel coronavirus, his physician Dr Kevin O'Connor said in a statement on Friday.
  • "Joe Biden and Dr Jill Biden underwent PCR testing for COVID-19 today and COVID-19 was not detected," the statement read.

(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

Kerala: Section 144 of the Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC), which prohibits assembly of five or more people at a time, has been imposed in #Thiruvananthapuram till 31st October, due to rising #COVID19 cases pic.twitter.com/OHy0tFA4CB

— ANI (@ANI) October 3, 2020

details.title: 25 states, UTs report fall in active cases
details.content:
India's COVID-19 death toll crossed one lakh and the infection tally climbed to 64,73,544, while the number of people who have recuperated from the disease crossed 54 lakh pushing the recovery rate to 83.84 per cent, the Union Health Ministry said on Saturday.

details.title: Sports update | Liverpool's Sadio Mane tests positive for Covid-19
details.content:
Liverpool's in-form Senegalese forward Sadio Mane has tested positive for Covid-19 and is self-isolating, the club said Friday.

Sadio Mane has tested positive for COVID-19 and is currently self-isolating according to the necessary guidelines.

— Liverpool FC (@LFC) October 2, 2020

details.title: Dr Reddy's seeks DCGI nod for conducting phase-three trial of Russian COVID-19 vaccine
details.content:
The Hyderabad-based Dr Reddy's Laboratories has applied to the Drugs Controller General of India for permission to conduct phase-3 human clinical trials of the Russian vaccine Sputnik V against COVID-19 in India, sources said. The Indian pharma giant has collaborated with the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) to conduct clinical trials of Sputnik V as well as its distribution.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Thiruvananthapuram strengthens coronavirus protocols due to rising cases
details.content:
Thiruvananthapuram District Collector Navjot Khosa has imposed Section 144 in Thiruvananthapuram district and banned congregations or public functions with more than five persons in outdoor spaces as part of the Covid control measures.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

Pakistan government has announced that the Gurdwara Kartarpur Sahib Corridor on its side has been reopened as COVID-19 situation in the country has improved.

details.title: Global update | COVID-19 spreads on panel handling US Supreme Court nomination
details.content:
Two Republican members of the Senate Judiciary Committee have tested positive for the coronavirus, raising questions about the timing of Supreme Court confirmation hearings for Judge Amy Coney Barrett and whether additional senators may have been exposed.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

US President Donald Trump (L) and Judge Amy Coney Barrett (R), arrive at the Rose Garden of the White House in Washington, DC. (Photo | AFP)

details.title: Kerala to replicate Pathanamthitta model to bring down Covid mortality among 60-plus age group
details.content:
With just six deaths -- five of them senior citizens while one was a 50-year-old -- due to the pandemic reported in the district so far, the proactive strategy of taking care of the aged and vulnerable employed by local authorities has proved an eye-opener.

details.title: India asks WTO to waive intellectual property norms
details.content:
India and South Africa want easy access to diagnostics, monoclonal antibodies, and vaccines for local production without the need for prolonged intellectual property negotiations.

details.title: Depression and anxiety tripled during lockdown
details.content: The study that the mental health impacts of the pandemic were especially pronounced in younger people, women and those who were unemployed or on low income. (READ HERE)

details.title: Delhi Prisons Dept wants emergency paroles extended
details.content:
• The Delhi Prisons department has requested the city government to extend the emergency parole granted to convicts by one month in view of the existing COVID-19 situation, officials said on Saturday.
  • In a letter to the home department, it said the emergency parole can be given considering the current pandemic situation.
  • According to the officials, there are currently 4,250 such inmates, comprising 3,100 undertrials on interim bail and 1,150 convicts on emergency parole, who are out of jails as part of the prisons department's recent decongestion drive.

details.title: 185 inmates test positive in Jammu
details.content:
• A total of 185 prisoners have tested positive for COVID-19 in different jails across the Jammu region, Director General of Prisons V K Singh said on Saturday.
  • He said temporary jails are being set up in various districts to isolate the asymptomatic positive detenues as part of efforts to ensure safety of the jail inmates and staffers.
  • Singh said roughly 200 prisoners, primarily in south Kashmir's Anantnag district jail and Srinagar Central Jail, have recovered from the infection over the past one month.
  • "In the past week, 185 prisoners across the Jammu region, including 56 in district Jail Amphalla and four in Kot Bhalwal Jail (Jammu district), 51 in district jail Kathua, 50 in district jail Rajouri and 24 in district jail Bhaderwah have tested positive for COVID-19.

details.title: Jharkhand minister dies
details.content: Minority Welfare Minister Haji Hussain Ansari died at Medanta Hospital in Ranchi on Saturday. Ansari was hospitalised after being tested positive for coronavirus on September 23. (READ HERE)

details.title: 61 more deaths in UP
details.content:
• With 3,665 fresh cases, Uttar Pradesh's COVID-19 tally reached 4,10,635 on Saturday, while 61 more fatalities pushed the death toll to 5,977.
  • The total number of people who have recovered from the disease has risen to 3,56,826 after 4,860 more patients were discharged on Saturday, a health department bulletin said.
  • The number of active cases in the state stands at 47,832, the bulletin said.
  • Among the new fatalities, seven were reported from Lucknow and four each from Gorakhpur, Varanasi, Meerut and Amroha.

details.title: Kerala reports highest single-day recovery
details.content: Kerala reported the highest single-day recoveries of 4,476 COVID-19 patients on Saturday, and 7,834 fresh cases. The death toll climbed to 813 with 22 more fatalities. (READ MORE)

details.title: Odisha issues SOP on use of Favipiravir
details.content: Odisha government on Saturday issued an SOP on the use of Favipiravir tablet by Covid-19 patients and asked district officials to ensure availability of the drug that can be administered to patients having symptoms under the supervision of trained doctors. (READ MORE)

details.title: Kerala records highest single day recoveries of 4,476 COVID patients
details.content: Kerala reported the highest single day recoveries of 4,476 COVID-19 patients on Saturday, and 7,834 fresh cases. The death toll climbed to 813 with 22 more fatalities. (READ MORE)

Ahead of UPSC exams which is scheduled to be held on Sunday, the teaching staff at exam halls were seen writing roll numbers of the aspirants on desks to help with their seating arrangements.
Visuals from a Government school in Coimbatore.

Express Photos | @rk_clicks@xpresstn pic.twitter.com/oz0aVbi7tW

details.title: Will reach pre-COVID levels by year-end: Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri
details.content:
Civil Aviation Minister Puri said domestic passenger traffic could reach the pre-COVID level by the end of current year.

He said the daily domestic traffic has reached 1.76 lakh passengers from 30,000 passengers when the civil aviation operations resumed on May 25 following a two-month gap due to the pandemic.

details.title: 2,258 fresh COVID-19 cases take Delhi's tally to over 2.87 lakh
details.content: The national capital recorded 2,258 fresh COVID-19 cases on Saturday, taking the tally to over 2.87 lakh, while 34 more fatalities took the death toll to 5,472, authorities said. This is the second day in a trot that the city reported less than 3,000 new cases. Authorities reported 2,920 new cases on Friday.

details.title: Total number of recoveries breach 5 lakh mark in Karnataka
details.content: Karnataka on Saturday reported 9,886 new cases of COVID-19 and 100 related fatalities, taking the total number of infections to 6,30,516 and death toll to 9,219, the health department said. The day also saw the total number of recoveries in the state breaching the 5 lakh mark, with 8,989 patients getting discharged.

details.title: 25 more COVID-linked deaths, 1,188 fresh cases in Haryana
details.content: Haryana reported another 25 fatalities on Saturday, raising the death toll from COVID-19 to 1,450 while 1,188 new cases pushed the infection tally to 1,32,576 in the state, according to a medical bulletin.

details.title: Distressed woman COVID-19 patient dies in Maharashtra, video goes viral
details.content: The video of a coronavirus- infected woman gasping for breath and then dying at a facility in Chandrapur in Maharashtra on Saturday went viral on social media, prompting the district administration to call for a report on the incident while some protesters flayed the administration for lack of health infrastructure in the district.

details.title: Noida cop at forefront of migrant crisis succumbs to COVID-19
details.content: An inspector in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddh Nagar succumbed to COVID-19 on Saturday, officials said, recalling his exemplary work as a "frontline warrior" during the coronavirus-induced lockdown. Amit Kumar Singh, in his 40s, was also heading the Phase 3 police station, the officials said.

details.title: COVID-19 situation better, cases showing downward trend: Delhi Health Minister
details.content: The COVID-19 situation in the city is far better now as compared to September and the daily cases have also begun to show a downward trend, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said on Saturday. Delhi was at number two but now has come down to the sixth spot in the country in terms of the number of COVID-19 cases, he told reporters.

details.title: Muzaffanagar records 41 fresh COVID-19 infections
details.content: Forty-one fresh COVID-19 infections were detected in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Saturday, taking the number of active cases in the district to 802, a senior official said. COVID-19 test results of 1,784 samples were received on Saturday and 41 of them came back positive, District Magistrate Selva Kumari J said.

details.title: 2,390 new coronavirus cases in Pune district
details.content: Pune district reported 2,390 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking its case count to 2,91,638, a health official said on Saturday evening. The death toll in the district reached 6,750 with 63 patients succumbing to the infection during this period.

details.title: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan donated his plasma in Odisha
details.content: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Saturday donated his plasma at SCB Medical College and Hospital in Cuttack for treatment of critical COVID-19 patients.

details.title: Tamil Nadu adds 5,622 new COVID-cases, tally mounts to 6.14 lakh
details.content: Tamil Nadu on Saturday recorded 5,622 new COVID-19 cases taking the overall tally to 6,14,507 while the death toll jumped to 9,718 with 65 more people succumbing to the virus, the Health department said. (READ MORE)

details.title: Sikkim reports 39 new cases, 2 deaths
details.content: Sikkim reported 39 new cases of COVID-19 and two more deaths on Saturday, an official said. East Sikkim registered 37 cases and the other two cases were recorded in South Sikkim. There are 640 active cases in the state at present, the official said.

details.title: 111 new cases take Nagaland's COVID-19 tally to 6,429
details.content:
At least 111 more people tested positive for COVID-19 in Nagaland on Saturday, raising the state's tally to 6,429, Health Minister S Pangnyu Phom said.

He appealed to the people to follow the health safety guidelines to contain the spread of the disease.

"Altogether 111 positive cases of COVID-19 were detected 63 in Kohima and 48 in Dimapur," the minister said on Twitter.

details.title: COVID-19 positive BJD leader Pradeep Maharathy put on ventilator support
details.content: Senior BJD leader and Pipili MLA Pradeep Maharathy, who had tested positive for COVID-19, was put on ventilator support after his health condition deteriorated, the ruling party in Odisha said on Saturday.

details.title: Oxford University coronavirus vaccine could be out within six months
details.content: There is growing hope that a vaccine against coronavirus may be given the green light by health regulators by the end of this year to be rolled out for a vaccination programme in six months' time or even less, according to a UK media report. (READ MORE)

details.title: Record one-day spike of 423 COVID-19 cases in Meghalaya pushes tally to 6,456
details.content:
Meghalaya registered its highest single-day spike of 423 COVID-19 cases on Saturday, which pushed the tally in the northeastern state to 6,456, a health department official said.

The death toll rose to 54 after two persons succumbed to the infection, Health Services Director Aman War said.
